info.name: ORACLE Hospitality OPERA Cloud Rest API Workflows
info.description:
#### ORACLE Hospitality OPERA Cloud Rest APIs

This Postman Collection offers many API call samples on how to perform different functional workflows against Oracle Hospitality REST APIs and OHIP (e.g. digital check-in and checkout). For more information visit [Oracle Hospitality Integration Platform](https://www.oracle.com/industries/hospitality/integration-platform/). 

New to OHIP?  Watch this free on demand video about [Stepping Through the OHIP Journey](https://go.oracle.com/LP=105035?elqCampaignId=281803&src1=:ow:o:p:po:::&intcmp=BUMK201218P00049:ow:o:p:po).  

To find out more about this Postman collection watch this free on demand video [Understanding Apiary Documentation & Postman Collections](https://go.oracle.com/LP=105035?elqCampaignId=281803&src1=:ow:o:p:po:::&intcmp=BUMK201218P00049:ow:o:p:po).  

Note that some of the APIs in this Postman collection are Early Adopter APIs (v0).  To find out about becoming an Early Adopter watch this free on demand video [Why be an OHIP Early Adopter](https://go.oracle.com/LP=105035?elqCampaignId=281803&src1=:ow:o:p:po:::&intcmp=BUMK201218P00049:ow:o:p:po).  

Explanations of the common workflows are available in [this workflows document](https://github.com/oracle/hospitality-api-docs/blob/main/postman-collections/WORKFLOWS.md).  

This document and all content within is available under the [Universal Permissive License v 1.0](https://oss.oracle.com/licenses/upl). Copyright c 2021 Oracle and/or its affiliates.

item.name: Common Workflows
Add an Accompanying Guest to a Reservation
Create New Profile If one doesn't exist

request.description: To update an existing reservation in OPERA by adding an accompanying guest (second profile)

item.description:
You can link guest profile as an accompanying guest on a reservation.  An accompanying guest is someone that also occupies the room but does not require a separate reservation account or has independent stay dates. If the guest requires a separate folio or has staggered arrival or departure dates use the Shares option instead. Using Accompanying Profiles on a reservation ensures that you can locate a guest via Manage Reservation search.


## Add an Accompanying Guest to a Reservation

item.name: Add Tickets to a Reservation

request.description: Use this operation to search for available packages at a property. You can search by date range, to see what packages are available to add to a reservation for example.

To first find available tickets to sell to a guest, use the operations
- getPackages in Rate module
- get Reservation Packages Group Items LOV (in ListOfValues module).

item.name: Get existing tickets on a reservation

request.description: This will retrieve any existing tickets that are on a reservation.

item.name: Update Existing Ticket on a reservation

request.description:
To first find available tickets to sell to a guest, use the operations
- getPackages in Rate module
- get Reservation Packages Group Items LOV (in ListOfValues module).

item.description:
Reservation Tickets enables you to manage the tickets available and issued for a reservation. This feature utilizes the reservation package functionality and works in conjunction with an integrated ticketing partner solution.


## Add Tickets to a Reservation

1. Search for available tickets
2. Post Tickets to an existing Reservation
3. Get Tickets that exist on a reservation
4. Update tickets on a reservation

item.name: Add a room number to a reservation

request.description: Use this API to add/assign a room number to a guests reservation. This is required before they can check into the property.
To check in a guest at the property.

item.description:
This workflow provides a suggested set of operations allowing the user to check in a guest, including searching for available rooms, assigning the room and then proceeding to check in the guest. 

## Check in a Guest

1. Find your Reservation
2. Split reservation if 2 or more rooms
3. Pre-Register Guest
4. Search Available& Inspected Rooms
5. Assign a Room
6. Check In a Guest

| **Business case** | **Rest api** | **Module** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Search for an existing Reservation** using available parameters. You can search by first name, last name, arrival date, reservation status and many more parameters. The response message will have all reservations returned that match your search criteria. Once you know the specific reservation ID for the right booking, proceed to next step – `getReservation`. | getReservations | Reservations (RSV) |
| **Retrieve a reservation's details** by specifying the Reservation Id in the request. This will return greater details for the reservation, depending upon your `fetchInstructions` query parameter. The reservation will need to be in "Due-In" status in order to check-in. | getReservation | Reservations (RSV) |
| **Split Reservations**. A common scenario is a reservation for 2 or more rooms. In order to be able to check in a guest, the reservation needs to be for 1 room only (to be able to assign a physical room). If you have a reservation for 2 rooms, perform the **putSplitMultiRoomReservation API**. This will essentially create a new reservation for the second room, and the 'new' reservation will automatically be linked to the initial reservation. You can use the **getLinkedSummary** API to find details of the new reservation. Then walk through the following steps to assign rooms to both reservations and check them in. | putSplitMultiRoomReservation getLinkedSummary | Reservations (RSV) |
| If a guest needs to **update their Reservation** with new Payment methods, use this API. | putReservation | Reservations (RSV) |
| **Update a profile** - depending upon what information exists on a guest profile, you may need to add more details, such as passport information, preferences, update address or email etc. Use the `putProfile` operation to add this data to the existing profile. Note – you will have received the guest's profile ID in the `getReservation` response | putProfile | Customer Relationship Management (CRM) |
| You can offer your guests the ability to check in for their reservations by **pre-registering**. When a reservation is pre-registered, all of the guest's information to finish the registration process is collected, including authorizing the guest's credit card for the reservation. This makes it easy to check in the reservation when the guests arrive and the assigned room is available. Note – this is dependent upon individual Hotel Configuration – pre-register rules. | postPreCheckIn | Reservations (RSV) |
| **Search for available, clean rooms** to assign to a reservation. We suggest that you always search with the following parameters: `hotelRoomStatus=Inspected` and `hotelRoomFrontOfficeStatus=Vacant` | getRooms | Front Office (FOF) |
| **Assign a room number** to the reservation. | postRoomsAssignments | Front Office (FOF) |
| **Check in a Guest** | postCheckIn | Front Office (FOF) |
| **Cancel (revert) a checked-in guest.** This will revert the status of the reservation to "Due-In". | deleteCheckIns | Front Office (FOF) |

item.name: Check Out

request.description: To fetch reservation from OPERA using ID
To update an existing reservation in OPERA by adding or removing Payment Methods

item.name: Get transaction codes to see what charges can be posted
Add a charge to the folio
Add a Payment to the Folio
Post a Folio, required before checking out a guest

item.description:
This workflow provides a suggested set of operations to use in order to check out the guest, as well as including posting charges, making payments viewing folio details.

## Check out a Guest

1. Retrieve Reservation
2. get Folio details
3. post billing charge
4. post billing payment
5. Check Out Guest

| **Business case** | **Rest api** | **Module** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Retrieve a reservation –** if you know the reservation Id use getReservation. If you need to search for a reservation with names, room number, arrival date, etc use `getReservations`. | getReservations getReservation | Reservations (RSV) |
| **Get the folio details**. This will return you information on the guests account (folio) and will advise the charges, payments and outstanding balances. | getFolios | Cashiering (CSH) |
| **Post a charge** to a guest's reservation/folio. For example a guest had chips from the mini bar, you can add this charge to their folio.  In order to know the charges that can be posted, use `getTransactionCodes` operation. | postBillingCharges getTransactionCodes | Cashiering (CSH) |
| **Post a payment** to the folio. From the folio details you will be able to see the balance for the guest's stay. You can post a payment to the folio using this operation to bring the balance to $0. | postBillingPayments | Cashiering (CSH) |
| **Generate Folio Number.** This operation is required once you have brought the folio balance to $0 and is used to generate the folio number and/or bill number. Use postFolios to perform this action. | postFolios | Cashiering (CSH) |
| **Check out a reservation**. Typically you will only be able to check out a guest if their folio balance is $0. | postCheckOuts | Cashiering (CSH) |

item.name: Contactless Guest Journey

request.description: To update an existing reservation in OPERA by attaching Preferences.

To fetch rooms from OPERA Cloud.
You could filter by hotelRoomStatus too, to only return Clean, Dirty, Inspected rooms for example.
Use this API to add/assign a room number to a guests reservation. This is required before they can check into the property.
To preregister reservaiton in OPERA

FetchBusinessEvents - to fetch business events from OPERA
A partner will need to have Business Events configured in a properties OPERA Cloud to be able to 'getBusinessEvents'
To check in a guest at the property.
This operation will only be available if the property has a valid intergration to a doorlocking system.
Use this API to add/assign a room number to a guests reservation. This is required before they can check into the property.
You can use getTransactionCodes, to see what other available charges a guest could make on their reservation/folio.
A reservation must have $0 balance, and be in 'Due-out' status to be able to check out.

item.description:
A detailed workflow of a guest's contactless journey, starting with availability and making a reservation, checking in the guest, adding an in-house service request, to finally checking out the guest.

## Contactless Guest Journey

Walk through the postman collection we created to build a contactless digital check-experiences. We use operations that can demonstrate how the different REST APIs exposed in OHIP can be called to deliver the full digital check-in experience. From room availability, pre-registration and room allocation, to actual check-in and check-out, these samples will show you how to digitalize the full guest journey.

item.name: Create a Posting Master Reservation on the block

item.description:
This workflow provides a suggested set of operations to use in order to create a new block in OPERA Cloud.

## Create a Block

1. Search operations in List Of Values module
2. Get Block Default Code
3. Create a Block
4. Update a Block – add notes to a Block
5. Get Block next status Code
6. Change Block Status
7. Create Block Posting Master Reservation

**For further detailed information on Block creation, please refer to OPERA Cloud Services User Guide located [here](https://docs.oracle.com/cd/F18689_01/doc.193/f23597/ch_blocks_intro.htm#OCSUH-Blocks-7D3B27F6).**

| **Business case** | **Rest api** | **Module** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Search operations in LOV, to use in postBlock request Body –** postBlock requires many values defined by hotels in OPERA Cloud.  To find the values available to use, search using these LOV operations`. | getBlockNewStatuses getBlockReservationTypes getBlockRateCodes getBlockOrigins getBlockBookingTypes | ListOfValues(LOV) |
| **Get Block Default Code**. This will return the Block Code that you can use in the postBlock operation. | getBlockDefaultCode | Blocks (BLK) |
| **Post a Block** Use this operation to create a new block.  Once you have created the block, you can then proceed to add rates, grid details, events etc. | postBlock | Blocks (BLK) |
| **Update a block with notes** Use this operation to update your block by adding notes to it. | putBlock | Blocks (BLK) |
| **Get Block Next status Code** Use this operation to find out what the next status available is for your block.  Block status have a flow, and only certain statuses can move to the next status. For example, a Definatee status can move to an Actual status, but it cant move to a tentative status.  This operation will tell you what statues your block can next move to | getNextStatusCodes | Blocks (BLK) |
| **Change Block Status** Use this operation to update the status of your block. | putBlockStatus| Blocks (BLK) |
| **Create Block Posting Master Reservation**. Use this operation to create the posting master Reservation. This is required before any guests can make a reservation against a block.  Posting Master reservations are typically used for Billing (various sales charges can be posted to this PM reservation) and Rooming Lists (the  Posting Master reservation is used as a template for reservations created via rooming list). | postBlockPostingMaster | Blocks (BLK) |

request.description: Room numbers with Roomtype and description

item.name: Update an event - change the event time

item.description:
This workflow provides a suggested set of operations to use in order to create a new event in OPERA Cloud. A Block must first exist, before you can create an Event.

## Create an Event

Creating an Event requires a Block to already exist. The following flow will set you on the path to creating a new event in OPERA Cloud:

1. Search for Catering Event Types
2. Get Event Statuses Available
3. Search Function Space Availability
4. Search for Rental Codes
5. Search for Room Setup Styles Available
6. Create a new Event with Function Space
7. Search for available Event Resources (Inventory Items)
8. Add Event Resources
9. Add notes to the event (putEvent)
10. Get Event Resources attached to the Event
11. Find next available Block Catering Status
12. Update Event - change the time of the event

**For further detailed information on Event creation, please refer to OPERA Cloud Services User Guide located [here](https://docs.oracle.com/cd/F18689_01/doc.193/f23597/t_osem_creating_events_from_manage_block.htm#OCSUH-task-1-1A51F12A).**

item.description:

## Create a Rate Plan

1. Search operations in List Of Values module
2. post Rate Plans
3. post Rate Plan packages
4. put Rate Plans (update)
5. post Rate Plan Schedules

7. put Rate Plan Schedules
8. get Rate Plan Schedules

request.description: Use this API to create a maintenances for a specific room - such as Air Conditioning needs fixing.  You can find the available Room maintenance codes from the operation in ListOfValues module - LOV getMaintenanceCodes.

use this operation to mark a Room Maintenance as resolved.  You will find the RoomMaintenanceId for the body of this request, from the get request - getRoomMaintenances.
Use this operation to mark a Room Maintenance as unresolved.

item.description:
Room Maintenance enables you manage and resolve maintenance requests such as changing a light bulb, repairing a faulty lock, service a faulty air conditioning unit and so on, for guest rooms.

## Managing Room Maintenance Requests

**For further detailed information, please refer to OPERA Cloud Services User Guide located [here](https://docs.oracle.com/cd/F18689_01/doc.193/f23597/t_maintenance_managing_maintenance_requests.htm#OCSUH-ManagingRoomMaintenanceRequests-6C9E3E4E).**

item.description:
Upgrade Rules enable you to configure the rules for calculating the reservation upgrade amounts. Rules define the date period, lead time, to/from room types and reservation filters, the upgrade pricing calculation and the sales charge transaction code to be used to post the upgrade revenue.


## Create an Upgrade Rule for Room Classes


_**For further detailed information on Reservation Upgrades, please refer to OPERA Cloud Services User Guide located [here](https://docs.oracle.com/cd/F18689_01/doc.193/f23597/t_admin_booking_configuring_reservation_upgrade_rules.htm).**_

item.name: Guest Messages for an In House Guest
Get Guest Messages on a reservation

item.description:
With the Messages feature, you can send messages to individual guest reservations or to a selected group of reservations, such as those linked to a block. You can maintain an unlimited number of messages on a reservation, mark the messages as received or not received.

## In House Guest - Guest Messages

**For further detailed information, please refer to OPERA Cloud Services User Guide located [here](https://docs.oracle.com/cd/F18689_01/doc.193/f42091/t_managing_reservations_messages.htm#OCSUH-ManagingMessages-00F7350E).**

item.name: Issue Guest a Digital Key

request.description: To check in a guest at the property.

This operation **postRoomKey** will only be available if the property has a valid intergration to a doorlocking system.

encoderId = 0 is typically the designation that a digital key is requested rather than a physical key

item.description:
The Digital Key workflow highlights the operations required for a guest to digitally receive their door key. An active Door Lock Interface with an Door Locking System is a pre-requisite.

## Digial Key

1. A Guest requests digital key from their mobile device
2. Hotel’s mobile app sends a **postRoomKey** to OHIP indicating a ‘digital’ key is requested
3. OHIP routes digital key request to OPERA Cloud and OPERA Cloud transforms the request to be sent out to an active Door Lock System IFC
4. OPERA Cloud routes Key Request to IFC8
5. IFC8 routes request to the active Door Lock System
6. Door Lock System responds either successful with ‘digital’ key data (track3) or failed response
7. IFC8 returns the response to OPERA Cloud, where data is saved
8. Response is returned through OHIP with the ‘digital key’ data string when success or appropriate error if there is a failure
9. OHIP routes response back to Hotel’s mobile app to handle (send to guest device or report failure)
11. Hotel’s mobile app handles the ‘digital key’ distribution to the guest’s device

item.description:
With a guest in house, you can post charges to the guest account by transaction code, price, and quantity. You can post charges in any of eight separate Windows on the guests Folio.


## In House Guest - Post a Charge 

**For further detailed information, please refer to OPERA Cloud Services User Guide located [here](https://docs.oracle.com/cd/F18689_01/doc.193/f42091/c_manage_billing_manage_billing.htm#OCSUH-ManageBilling-A3ED7CA0).**

item.name: Property Interfaces - Guest Inquiry

request.description:
**PostInquiry Sample to get guest information by Room number**

/rsv/v1/hotels/**HotelId**/reservations?roomId=**RoomId**  
  
used by systems who want to get current information of a specific Room.

e.g. Point-Of-Sale systems where guest wants to charge his bill to his room.  
Waiter/user would send request for information if room is currently checked in and get some Guest and reservation information.

**PostInquiry Sample to get guest information by Guest Name**

/rsv/v1/hotels/**HotelId**/reservations?surname=\[EnterName\]&searchType=InHouse&=Reservation

used by systems who want to get current information of a specific Guest Name

e.g. Point-Of-Sale systems where guest wants to charge his bill to his room.  
Waiter/user would send request for information if the Guest Name is currently checked in and get some Guest and reservation information.

if multiple guests with same name as inquired by are checked in PMS will respond with multiple results.

**PostInquiry Sample to get guest information by Guest Name**

/rsv/v1/hotels/**HotelId**/reservations?surname=surname=G&searchType=InHouse&limit=2  
  

used by systems who want to get current information of a specific Guest Name and request only a specific amount of result records back. (Use of "limit" parameter in URI)

e.g. Point-Of-Sale systems where guest wants to charge his bill to his room.  
Waiter/user would send request for information if the Guest Name is currently checked in and get some Guest and reservation information.

if multiple guests with same name as inquired by are checked in PMS will respond with multiple results.

"limit" parameter set to "2" in this example to return only 2 results

use the "offset" parameter to request further set of results

**PostInquiry Sample to get guest information by Guest Name with first letter of Name**

/reservations?searchType=InHouse&=Reservation&surname=B  
  

used by systems who want to get current information of a specific Guest Name where the first letter(s) of the Guest Last name are used

e.g. Point-Of-Sale systems where guest wants to charge his bill to his room.  
Waiter/user would send request for information if the Guest Name is currently checked in and get some Guest and reservation information.

if multiple guests with same name as inquired by are checked in PMS will respond with multiple results.

**PostInquiry Sample to get guest information by ReservationId**

/rsv/v1/hotels/**HotelId**/reservations/**ReservationId**?searchType=InHouse  
  

used by systems who want to get current information of a specific reservationId.

system would send request for information if a Guest with specific reservationId is currently checked in and get some Guest and reservation information.

reservationId is a unique id created in PMS for each reservation.

item.description:
Guest Inquiry - facilitates the option to inquire guest / reservation information in order to sending charges to a specific guest.

## Guest Inquiry
Typically used by Point-Of-Sale systems, Spa Systems, Golf Systems, HSIA Systems performing Room charges where the system will send inquiry to the PMS to look if a guest is really checked in to the hotel before sending charges to the account.

Inquiries can be done by

*   roomId
*   Name
*   First letters of a name
*   reservationId
*   (track2 data - room key data) - not yet available!
    

PMS will send related guest / reservation information back as response message.

with this information the POS system can then send the charge to the guest's account using the **HPI-PostRequest** API.

item.name: Property Interfaces - Guest Messages

request.description:
**HPI-GuestMessages - Post new Guest text message to PMS**

/rsv/v0/hotels/{{HotelId}}/reservations/{{ReservationId}}/guestMessages  
  

External system sends a new guest text message to the PMS for a specific checked in reservationId.

**messageText** = Guest message text to store in PMS

**messageDate** = Date and Time the message has been created

**typeOfMessage** = "Tm" = text message

**operator** =

**deliveryStatus** = "Nr" - not received

**textMessageSentBy** = App Id / name

In response of the POST new message the PMS sends a Message Id

**id:** "xxx"

item.name: Get a Guest Message by reservationId

request.description:
**HPI-GuestMessges - Get guest messages by reservation**

using

/rsv/v1/hotels/{{HotelId}}/reservations/{{ReservationId}}?fetchInstructions=GuestMessages

fetchInstructions = GuestMessags

will list all Guest text messages of the reservationId

with message **deliveryStatus** either Not received ("Nr") or delivered ("Mr")

**HPI-GuestMessages Update Message delivery status**

using

/rsv/v0/hotels/{{HotelId}}/reservations/{{ReservationId}}/guestMessages/30290

sending the messageId to update in the URI

with the message details in the body

**deliveryStatus** \= "Mr" (delivered) or "Nr" (not delivered).

**deliveryDate** = Date and time stamp when the message has been delivered

**deliveredBy** = App Id /Name (will be shown on the message information in PMS)

item.name: Delete a Guest Message by ID

request.description:
**HPI-GuestMessages - Delete Guest message from PMS**

using

DELETE

/rsv/v0/hotels/{{HotelId}}/reservations/{{ReservationId}}/guestMessages/30290

the URI contains the MessageId to delete.

item.description:
Operations that utilize Guest Text Messages set by OPERA Cloud or set by an external system. A integrated system can either notify a guest of the existence of a message (e.g. a message lamp on a telephone set, an indicator on a TV or other guest facing device in the room), or it can display the full message to the guest.

## Guest Messages Possible Actions:

*   Post a new Guest text message to PMS for a specific reservation checked in
*   Get current guest text messages linked in PMS for a specific reservation
*   Update status of an existing guest text message linked in PMS for a specific reservation (set to delivered)
*   Delete guest text messages from the PMS for an existing reservation
    

## General

**There are different approaches to message handling.**

A system can either **notify** a guest of the existence of a message (e.g. a message lamp on a telephone set, an indicator on a TV or other guest facing device in the room) - or it can **display** the full message itself to the guest.

While handling guest text messages, always keep in mind that different guests can be checked into a room, so handling messages must be done in relation to the Reservation-ID (GuestNum) and not in relation to a room RoomNum).

## **Notification and Request Message:**

A notification is done by using the RoomEquipment Business Event (BE). Using **RoomEquipment BE** with the message-light field can be done room-based (only using RoomNum) or guest-based (RoomNum + GuestNum).

It is required to use this feature guest-based if guest text messages should be handled opposed to switching on a light on a telephone-set or on a TV.

The OPERA will now signal new messages through sending out the **RoomEquipment BE** message. The external system can now alert the guest about the new message by switching on a light or other notification in the guest room (or even on the guest's device).  
Once the guest acknowledges the alert and requests to see the message, it can now be requested through the message request record **GetGuestMessages**.

Once the message has been requested and PMS sent out the message details the status of the message in the OPERA PMS system can now be changed to "retrieved"/"delivered" by sending an status update message (PUT) to the PMS with the updated deliveryStatus value (**Mr**)

## **On-Line messages /Send Text messages to vendor:**

If on-line messages should be used, then different records must be defined:

a Business Event for GuestMessages will be sent by right when a guest text message is entered in PMS or a status will be changed (delivered, deleted)

The delete GuestMessage is used to signal back to OPERA that a guest has now read a message.

item.name: Property Interfaces - Locator
Post or set new Locator on a reservation

request.description:
**HPI Locator - set a new locator**

/rsv/v0/hotels/{{HotelId}}/reservations/{{ReservationId}}/guestLocators

Example message to set a new Guest Locator for a specific reservation.

**dateSpan:** Date for when the locator information shall be active (the guest is meant to be on a specific location)

**timeSpan:** Time span (from to) for when the locator information shall be active (the guest is meant to be at a specific location)

**locatorText:** Location name

**locatorOn:** Date and time when the locator has been set (information in locator detail in PMS)

**locatorBy:** system which set the locator

**HPI Locator - Retrieve locator**

GET  
/rsv/v0/hotels/SAND01/reservations/47009/guestLocators

Example message to retrieve locators for a specific reservation.

requires the reservationId in the URI.

item.name: Delete a Locator per ReservationId & Locator ID

request.description:
**HPI Locator - Delete guest locator**

DEL  
/rsv/v0/hotels/{{HotelId}}/reservations/{{ReservationId}}/guestLocators/\[locatorId\]  
  

Example message to delete locators for a specific reservation in PMS

requires the **reservationId** and the specific **locatorId.**

item.description:
Use these operation to indicate where a guest is in the hotel, if not in their room and leave a locator notification in OPERA Cloud for informational purpose. A typical situation is where a guest is waiting for an important call or fax but goes to the restaurant for lunch. A locator set by the POS can inform the Front Desk or switchboard personnel where the guest can be found.  

## Property Interface - Locator API
  
A typical situation is where a guest is waiting for an important call or fax but goes to the restaurant for lunch. A locator set by the POS can inform the Front Desk or switchboard personnel where the guest can be found.   However, if the functionality is required, any system may send or retrieve locators.

Please note that there can only be **one** active locator for a guest at any time. This might seem to lead to some problems if multiple systems are setting the locator, but in reality, the guest can only be in one place at a time.

## Possible actions:

*   **Set** a new locator for a specific reservation
*   **Retrieve** active locators for a specific reservation
*   **Delete** active locators for a specific reservation
    

**When turning a locator off (Delete Locator)**, it is advisable that the external system **first retrieves** the current (if existing) locator for that guest to verify that it is not turning off a locator set by another system.

item.description:
Operations to facilitate sending charges to a specific guest room. Typically used by Point-Of-Sale systems, Spa Systems, Golf Systems, HSIA Systems performing Room charges where the system will send inquiry to OPERA Cloud to check if a guest is  checked in to the property and then sending the PostRequest charge record to the guest account OPERA Cloud.


## Property Interfaces - Post Request

It is possible to send multiple sub amounts for one guest check to post to the room within one message.  
See related examples.

## **Void postings:**

are possible to send with either

negative ***amount*** value (-5.50)  
and positive ***postingQuantity*** value (1)

or with

positive ***amount*** value (5.50)  
and negative ***postingQuantity*** value (-1)

See related examples.

item.description:
Post Simple Charges facilitate the option sending charges to the PMS Guest Room account right after revenue has been created.

## PostSimple charges can be charges:

*   done by a **Phone system** sending the final amount of a phone charge
*   done by a **System sending charges for minibar article consumption** on a guest room either by total amount or by article number
*   done by **TV or Video service systems** sending charges for Pay TV channel by total amount
*   done by **HSIA systems** sending charges for Internet access & data consumption to the guest room
    

For PostSimple charges it is not necessary to inquire for the guest prior to sending the charge. However a ReservationId must be sent as currently no Room number is available within this API.

## **Required attributes:**

*   reservationId
*   transactionCode
*   amount
*   articleCode (for minibar postings)

**GuestServiceStatus** option can be set by a hotel guest itself through a vendor system option to set a Do Not Disturb or a Make Up Room notification similar to the Door sign he can hang out outside the room door so housekeeping or Room service staff is aware.

roomList = Room number

status = DoNotDisturb, MakeUpRoom or NoStatusSelected

request.description:

roomList = Room number

status = DoNotDisturb, MakeUpRoom or NoStatusSelected

roomList = Room number

status = DoNotDisturb, MakeUpRoom or NoStatusSelected

item.name: Post a Guest Message - New Voicemail

request.description:
**HPI-RoomEquipment - Set New Voice mail notification**

POST /rsv/v0/hotels/**HotelId**/reservations/**ReservationId**/guestMessages  
  

Typically used by telephone systems who handle voice mail on a phone set of a room.

Example API message to set or update a Voice mail notification for a specific reservation (Not Room!!) when a voice mail has been left on a phone set.  
This will create a new Guest Text message in the PMS for the specific reservation.

#### **values:**

**messageText**: Message text being visible in the guest text message created in PMS

**messageDate:** Date message is being created

**typeOfMessage:** Tm - Text Message

**receipient:** (optional) Guest name, first name (if available)

**operator:** System sending the message

**deliveryStatus:** "Nr" - new message (not received)

**textMessageSentBy:** System / user sending the message

item.name: Update Guest Message - Voicemail Off - delivered

request.description:
**HPI-RoomEquipment - Update New Voice mail notification**

PUT /rsv/v0/hotels/**HotelId**/reservations/**ReservationId**/guestMessages  

Typically used by telephone systems who handle voice mail on a phone set of a room.

Example API message to update a Voice mail notification for a specific reservation (Not Room!!) when a voice mail has been checked by the hotel guest.  
This will update the existing Guest Text message in the PMS with status "delivered" for the specific reservation.

#### **values:**

**messageText**: Message text being visible in the guest text message created in PMS

**messageDate:** Date message is being created

**typeOfMessage:** Tm - Text Message

**recipient:** (optional) Guest name, first name (if available)

**deliveryStatus:** "Mr" - message received/delivered

**deliveryDate:** Date/time stamp the message has been delivered / system sent the update message

**deliveredBy:** system/user which sends the status update.

item.description:
This workflow can be used to send specific room related status information to OPERA Cloud, which will be shown to the user in corresponding section. Including Housekeeping, Guest Service Status, Guest Text messsage.

## Possible actions:

*   **sending Housekeeping Room Status** for a room  
    (Clean, Dirty, Inspected, Pickup)
*   **sending GuestService Status** for a room  
    (MakeUpRoom, DoNotDisturb)can be set by a hotel guest itself through a vendor system option to set a Do Not Disturb or a Make Up Room notification similar to the Door sign he can hang out outside the room door so housekeeping or Room service staff is aware.
*   **sending New VoiceMail notification** for a specific reservation (Not Room!!) when a voice mail has been left on a phone set  
    This will create a new Guest Text message in the PMS for the specific reservation
*   **sending update of existing VoiceMail message** with status "delivered".  
    Commonly sent when the guest did check the voice mail on the phone set.  
    The Guest Text message status on the guest account will be changed to "delivered".

item.name: Property Interfaces - Wake Up Calls

request.description:
## HPI WakeUp - example for setting a new Wake up call notification to PMS for one wakeup at a specific day for a specific Wake time

**reservationId** = the reservation id of the guest residing in the room

**room** = room number

**callTime** = Wake date and wake time

**isFollowUpCall** = false/true mark the call notification as a follow up call or not

**status** = status code **"Pending"** - call to execute (information for the user only)

**timeSpan  
startDate** = Date span for eventually multiple wake up call on multiple days

item.name: Create a Wakeup call - set a daily wakeup

request.description:
## HPI WakeUp - example for setting a new Wake up call notification to PMS for daily wakeup for a specific Wake time

**reservationId** = the reservation id of the guest residing in the room

**room** = room number

**callTime** = Wake date and wake time

**isFollowUpCall** = false/true mark the call notification as a follow up call or not

**status** = status code **"Pending"** - call to execute (information for the user only)

**timeSpan  
startDate** = first day of daily wake up call  
**endDate** = last day of daily wake up call

item.name: Update a Wakeup call - result is Completed

request.description:
## HPI WakeUp - example for sending a Wake up call result notification to PMS

**reservationId** = the reservation id of the guest residing in the room

**room** = room number

**callTime** = Wake date and wake time

**isFollowUpCall** = false/true mark the call notification as a follow up call or not

**status** = status code **"Completed"** - status for successfully executed wakeup call

**timeSpan****startDate** = Date span for eventually multiple wake up call on multiple days

item.name: Update a Wakeup call - result is NoAnswer

request.description:
## HPI WakeUp - example for sending a Wake up call result notification to PMS

**reservationId** = the reservation id of the guest residing in the room

**room** = room number

**callTime** = Wake date and wake time

**isFollowUpCall** = false/true mark the call notification as a follow up call or not

**status** = status code **"NoAnswer"** - status for unsuccessfully executed wakeup call - guest did not pick up the phone/did not reacted on the wake up call

**timeSpan****startDate** = Date span for eventually multiple wake up call on multiple days

item.name: Update a Wakeup call - set a new wakeup time

request.description:
### HPI WakeUp - example for sending a Wake up call update notification to PMS - change of Wake up time

**reservationId** = the reservation id of the guest residing in the room

**room** = room number

**callTime** = **old** wake up date and wake up time

**isFollowUpCall** = **false/true** mark the call notification as a follow up call or not

**status** = status code **"pending"** - call to execute (information for the user only)

**timeSpan**

**startDate** = Date span for eventually multiple wake up call on multiple days

**newCallTime:** new wake up date and wake up time

### Note:

this will create a NEW Wake up and set the old wake up call to "cancelled" in the PMS.

## HPI WakeUp - example for sending a delete Wake up call notification to PMS

URI has parameter for reservationId, callTime and startDate of the wakeup call to delete in PMS.

### Note:

this will set the wake up call to **"cancelled"** in the PMS.

item.description:
Used to create, update or delete Wake up calls for Guest rooms/reservations.

## Who shall utilize the WakeUp API:

Wake up calls shall only be created, updated, deleted by those systems really handling and executing wakeup calls respective are connecting with those systems as middleware.

## Wake up calls in the PMS system:

The PMS system handles wake up calls set by its users or by external systems by storing them for informational purpose.  This is crucial for the Hotel to know wake up calls have been set by which system and what their result are since the hotel guests will always complain at the hotel reception on when a wake up has not been working and guest wasn't woken up.

Wake up calls can also be set, updated and deleted also in the PMS system, therefore related Business Events will be used to retrieve wakeup calls once they have been entered in the PMS system - to keep them until execution.

## General API Functionality:

**Create new wake up calls for a checked-in reservation for a specific date and wake time.**

**Create new wake up calls** for a checked-in reservation **for a specific date** **for multiple wake times** (follow up call)

**Create new wake up calls** for a checked-in reservation **for multiple days (e.g. entire stay) for a specific wake time**

**Create new wake up calls** for a checked-in reservation **for multiple days for multiple wake times** (follow up call)

**Update existing wake up calls with new wake times or updated status (Result)**

**Delete existing wake up calls**

item.name: Queue Rooms
item.description:
At times, guests arrive before their assigned room or a room of their chosen room type is available for assignment. The OPERA Cloud Queue Reservations/Queue Rooms feature is designed to help you manage room assignments and ensure guests are checked into their rooms rapidly by coordinating front desk and housekeeping efforts.

## Queue Rooms 

1. Add Reservation to Queue
2. Get Reservations in Queue
3. Remove a Reservation from the Queue
4. Get Reservation Queue Statistics


**For further detailed information, please refer to OPERA Cloud Services User Guide located [here](https://docs.oracle.com/cd/F18689_01/doc.193/f23597/t_arrivals_in-house_adding_reservation_to_queue.htm#OCSUH-AddingAReservationToTheQueue-98A14074).**

request.description: To cancel a reservaiton in OPERA Cloud.

item.description:
This workflow provides a suggested set of operations which allows the user to check the availability at a property, including available rate plans and room types, and then proceed to make a reservation.  

## Search Availability and book a Reservation

1. Search for Hotel Availability
2. Get Rate Plan Information
3. Get Packages and/or Inventory Items
4. Get Cancel, Deposit& Guarantee Policies
5. Get Payment Methods
6. Create Reservation

_**For further detailed information on Reservation Upgrades, please refer to OPERA Cloud Services User Guide located [here](https://docs.oracle.com/cd/F18689_01/doc.193/f23597/ch_reservations.htm#OCSUH-Reservations-Intro-B980D12E).**_

| **Business case** | **Rest api** | **Module** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Search Availability** for a property. This API is used to request availability at a property, showing you the room types and rate plans that are available. With the response, you can choose which rate code & room type combination you wish to make a booking for, and use these room type code and rate plan codes in the `postReservation` request. | getHotelAvailability | Availability (PAR) |
| **Get Rate Plan Information** – specify the Rate Plan Code in the path to retrieve more details about the rate plan, such as the Rate Long Description, commission and market code. | getRatePlan | Rates (RTP) |
| **Get available Packages**. Often a guest wants to 'add-on' to their reservation, and add extras such as buffet breakfast, or a box of chocolates. Use this API to find the available packages and their price. You can then use the package codes in either `postReservation` or `putReservation` to add these packages to a reservation. | getPackages | Rates (RTP) |
| **Get Guarantee Policies** – these policies can be used to display to a guest, to see how they will guarantee their booking. A hotel might allow a 6PM policy, which might not require a credit card, or they might only allow a Guarantee to CC policy. | getGuaranteePolicies | Availability (PAR) |
| **Get Payment Methods** – this will return available Payment Methods for a hotel, such as CASH, VISA, AMEX. You will need these codes to use in the `postReservation` request. | getPaymentMethods | List Of Values (LOV) |
| **Get existing guest profile**. During the process of making a reservation you can create a new profile (i.e. within a `postReservation`) OR you can use an existing profile. This would be the case if a guest has already stayed at the property and therefore search for an existing profile using getProfiles. The response will contain the profile Id, which you can then include within the body of the postReservation. | getProfiles getProfile | Customer Relationship Management (CRM) |
| **Create new reservation** – Now that you know the rate plan code, room type, payment methods, etc, you can go ahead and postReservation. In the response, you will see the `location` header – this contains the reservation Id. You can use this reservation Id to update a reservation. | postReservation | Reservations (RSV) |
| **Update reservation** – add packages, comments, change details of the stay. So much can be used for this operation, you will need to know the reservation id for the path. | putReservation | Reservations (RSV) |

item.name: Upgrade a Reservation
Retrieve reservation and see if an upsell offer is available

request.description: To fetch reservation from OPERA using ID

item.name: Find available upsell offers to present to a guest
Add an upsell to a reservation
Remove an upsell from a reservation
See if an upsell exists on a reservation

item.description:
The Upgrade a Reservation workflow highlights the operations required to fetch available offers, and then add the upgrade offer information to a reservation, should the guest accept the upgrade offer.

## Upgrade a Reservation

Offer the guest an upgrade.

1. getReservation
2. getAvailableUpsells
3. postUpsell
4. getUpsell
5. deleteUpsell

_**For further detailed information on Reservation Upgrades, please refer to OPERA Cloud Services User Guide located [here](https://docs.oracle.com/cd/F18689_01/doc.193/f23597/t_managing_reservation_upgrade_offers.htm).**_

| **Business case** | **Rest api** | **Module** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Get a reservation and see if there is an available offer for the guest.** Fetch the existing reservation, and see if there are any available upgrade offers that an be presented to the guest. | getReservation | Reservation (RSV) |
| **Search to see details of available upgrade offers.** Only if there are offers available can you then present these to the guest. Note - you cannot upgrade reservations under the following conditions - the reservation status is Checked In, Cancelled, No Show, or Waitlist, a shared reservation, or a fixed rate reservation. | getAvailableUpsells | Availability (PAR) |
| Use this API to **add the upsell offer** to a guest's reservation. You will need to know the upsell offer code, which you will get in the `getUpsells` response message. | postUpsells | Reservations (RSV) |
| If you wish to **remove an upsell offer from a reservation** , use this API. | deleteUpsells | Reservations (RSV) |
| If you want to check if a reservation has an upgrade on it, **use getUpsell** operation using the reservation id in the request. | getUpsell | Reservations (RSV) |

| **Configuration of Upgrade Rules** | **Rest api** | **Module** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Configure and add **a new upgrade rule** for a property. You can add rules on room type level, or room class level. | postUpsellRule | Reservations Configuration (RSV/Config) |
| **Update an existing upsell rule** | putUpsellRule | Reservations Configuration (RSV/Config) |
| **Remove an upsell Rule**. This will completely delete the rule, and no longer be available to use/sell. | deleteUpsellRule | Reservations Configuration (RSV/Config) |
| **Test an upsell rule**. In the Body of this request you can add rates, room type and test to see if a rule will be returned. | testUpsellRule | Reservations Configuration (RSV/Config) |
| **Get all configured upsell rules** for a property. | getUpsellRules | Reservations Configuration (RSV/Config) |

This Postman Collection offers many API call samples on how to perform different functional workflows against Oracle Hospitality REST APIs and OHIP (e.g. digital check-in and checkout). For more information visit [Oracle Hospitality Integration Platform](https://www.oracle.com/industries/hospitality/integration-platform/).
